4. The general accidental release program and the specific prevention steps;

This distribution facility is covered by OSHA's Process Safety Management Regulations (PSM) and  EPA's Accidental Release Prevention Rule (RMP) and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local codes and regulations.  Access to the site is restricted to authorized employees, authorized management personnel and authorized contractors. The sodium Hypochlorite manufactured at this facility is an EPA registered pesticide under the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act (FIFRA), and has UL Approval. This facility is operated in accordance with recommendations from the Chlorine Institute.

5. Five-year accident history

We have had no accidental releases of chlorine in the past five years.

6. The emergency response program

This facilities emergency response program is based upon the Chlorine Institute's Pamphlet 64, Emergency Response Plans for Chlorine Facilities. We have discussed this program with the County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) and the City Fire Department. Representatives of the City of Albany Department of Fire and Emergency Services toured the facility in October 2003. Members of the Fire Department Hazardous Materials Unit were trained in joint exercises on the installation of an Emergency "C" Kit on a chlorine tank car simulator provided by Surpass in a simulation drill conducted in 2006. 
An Incident Response Team has been created and training is ongoing.Objective is to have a group of employees trained to respond to any minor spill or situation that may occur at Surpass. We would not respond to any off site incidents. 


7. Planned changes to improve safety

A Powell Continuous Bleach manufacturing system was completed in April of 2005. A Chlorine scrubber system was installed to evacuate the entire piping systems as well as all new process controls including additional chlorine detectors.
